official_title: A bill to provide a special program for financial assistance to national community-based organizations of demonstrated effectiveness, in order to provide one million new jobs and job training opportunities for structurally unemployed and unemployable youth.
short_title: National Community Based Organizations Youth Job Creation and Training Act of 1979

summary.text: National Community-Based Organizations Youth Job Creation and Training Act of 1979 - Directs the Secretary of Labor to enter into contracts with prime sponsors of Comprehensive Employment and Training Act programs to provide set-aside funds for community-based organizations for the provision of : (1) comprehensive employment services and jobs for unemployed youth; (2) career education and counseling services for secondary school students; (3) career education for unemployed youth; or (4) work-study projects in community improvement for unemployed youth. Directs the head of each agency exercising authority under specified programs to assure that special consideration will be given to national community-based organizations in providing employment services and job opportunities pursuant to such programs. Amends the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act of 1973 to direct the Secretary to provide such work experience during all months of the year to youth in urban and rural areas. Amends the work incentive program provisions of the Internal Revenue Code to permit a tax credit with respect to wages paid certain previously unemployed employees during the first 12 months of employment.
